gate0.name: Structural Column Assessment
gate0.notes: Human reported column stud doesn't go into soffit, awaiting contractor opinion. Per orchestrator rules: assume column stays for safer design.

gate1.name: Final Cabinet Face Design
gate1.decision: APPROVED - Human-specified 30" drawers + 30" barn door + 32" double door layout
gate1.notes: Human approved design in Session 2 feedback. Layout: drawers(30") + barn door opening(30") + double door(32") = 92". Visualization at cabinet-face-final.jsx.

gate2.name: Butcher Block Commitment
gate2.decision: APPROVED - Lowe's Allen+Roth Chevron Acacia 72x39x1.5 (buy 2, join)
gate2.notes: Human decided: Go with 2x Lowe's Allen+Roth Chevron Acacia 72"x39"x1.5". 1.5" thickness accepted. Will join two pieces.

gate3.name: Construction Approach Lock
gate3.decision: APPROVED - Hybrid no-table-saw approach with big box rips + miter saw + circular saw
gate3.notes: Human approved hybrid construction approach in Session 2 feedback. Pocket holes for joinery, big box store rips for sheet goods, miter/circular saw for rest.

gate4.name: Final Dimensions Sign-off
gate4.decision: CONFIRMED - All dimensions locked: 92" length, 40" height, 14" depth, 30" counter, 30/30/32 section split
gate4.notes: Human confirmed dimensions in Session 3. WS4 cut list generation now unblocked.

gate5.name: Build Manual Review
gate5.notes: Build manual complete. Awaiting human review and approval.

iterations.notes: 3 options created, Option B recommended - REJECTED by human
Human-specified design documented. Visualization already existed. FINAL-DESIGN.md created.

ws2.name: Butcher Block Research

iterations.notes: 5 vendors, Lowe's + lamination recommended - APPROVED by human

ws2.human_decision: Buy 2x Lowe's Allen+Roth Chevron Acacia 72"x39"x1.5", join them

iterations.notes: Pocket holes locked, 4-weekend build sequence - NEEDED UPDATE
Refire complete: no-table-saw workflow, drawer construction, barn door guide, X-frame panels, BUILD-SEQUENCE-v2
Opus rerun: Ruthless optimization. Build time reduced 45-50h to 35-40h. Added BEST-PRACTICES, CRITICAL-PATH, INTEGRATION-CHECKLIST, BUILD-SEQUENCE-FINAL.
Fixed tool-list.md: Removed incorrect table saw reference, updated to no-table-saw build.
Sonnet: Initial cut lists, plywood layouts, shopping lists
Opus rerun: Cross-referenced all WS1-WS7. Added foot rail backing, wire routing holes, electrical integration, updated costs.
Hardware research complete: barn door kit, hinges, pulls, pre-made vs DIY analysis. Matte black hardware throughout.
Opus agent: Paint colors (Hale Navy/Iron Ore), butcher block finish (Rubio Monocoat), 4-week finishing sequence. ~$502 materials.
Opus agent: Pop-up outlet ($295), LED lighting 2-zone ($184), foot rail 2" matte black ($240). Wire routing diagrams. ~$840 total.

Opus: Complete validation of 41+ files. 96% confidence. Fixed tool-list.md table saw reference. Created VALIDATION-REPORT, CONSOLIDATED-BOM, CONSOLIDATED-TOOL-LIST, PHASE-INTEGRATION-MAP, WS9-PREPARATION-BRIEF.
Opus: Complete 63KB build manual with 11 chapters + appendices. Print-ready. Includes BUILD-MANUAL.md, QUICK-REFERENCE.md, SHOPPING-CHECKLIST.md, BUILD-TRACKER.md.

sessions.notes: Initial parallel kickoff. All 3 streams completed but WS1 rejected, WS3 needs update.

Refire session. WS1 documentation updated for human-specified design. WS3 refired with no-table-saw constraints, drawer/barn door/X-frame guides added. Gate 2 cleared. Gates 1 and 3 ready for human approval.

Session 3: Cleared all remaining gates. Completed WS4-WS7. Opus reruns on WS3 (optimization), WS4 (cross-reference), WS6, WS7. Build time reduced 45-50h to 35-40h. All 7 work streams complete. Ready for WS8 integration.

Session 4: CAPSTONE SESSION. WS8 Integration & Validation (Opus) validated all 41+ files at 96%+ confidence. Fixed tool-list.md table saw error. WS9 Build Manual (Opus) synthesized complete 63KB print-ready manual. Gate 5 ready for human review. PROJECT DOCUMENTATION COMPLETE.
